title: Relates to license terms for new applicants
summary: Relates to license terms for new applicants.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2704

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 28, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  SEWARD -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Insurance

       AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to license terms  of  new
         applicants

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Paragraph 3 of subsection j of section 2103 of  the  insur-
    2  ance  law,  as  added  by chapter 769 of the laws of 1984, is amended to
    3  read as follows:
    4    (3) [Such licenses may be issued for all of such two year  terms,  or,
    5  upon  application made during any such term, for the balance thereof] IN
    6  THE CASE OF A LICENSE ISSUED TO A NEW APPLICANT, THE SUPERINTENDENT  MAY
    7  ISSUE  A  LICENSE  FOR  A TERM OF MORE THAN TWO YEARS, PROVIDED HOWEVER,
    8  SUCH TERM SHALL NOT EXCEED THIRTY MONTHS.
    9    S 2. Paragraph 1 of subsection c of section 2132 of the insurance law,
   10  as added by chapter 656 of the laws of  1992,  is  amended  to  read  as
   11  follows:
   12    (1)  Any  person holding a license issued pursuant to this article and
   13  not exempt under subsection (b) of this section shall, during each  full
   14  biennial  licensing  period, SUBSEQUENT TO THE INITIAL LICENSING PERIOD,
   15  satisfactorily complete courses or programs  of  instruction  or  attend
   16  seminars  as may be approved by the superintendent equivalent to fifteen
   17  credit hours of instruction.
   18    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.



        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD08793-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to license terms of new applicants
